author: BEN HARTMAN
title: Jewish teen from Jerusalem indicted for throwing rock at police during riot - Arab-Israeli Conflict
text:
A Jewish teenager was indicted by a Jerusalem juvenile court on Thursday for throwing stones at police officers during a spontaneous protest on Monday night in the city that spun out of control.
According to the indictment, the 15-year-old Jerusalem resident was taking part in a protest at Shabbat square in the city during which a number of people were shouting “death to the Arabs” and throwing rocks and other items at vehicles driven by Arabs and at security personnel which had been summoned to the scene.
Prosecutors maintain that when security personnel began to break up the protest, the teenager threw a rock at a police officer some 10 meters away from it. The rock missed and as police then began attempting to arrest the teen he resisted arrest and struggled with the police.
He now faces charges of aggravated attempted assault of a police officer and interfering with a police officer on duty. Prosecutors on Thursday issued a request that he be kept in custody until the end of proceedings against him.
The Jerusalem Magistrate’s Court on Thursday also indicted a 31-year-old Arab resident of the Old City named Mu’awiya Hiri for throwing stones at police officers from the roof of his house on a number of occasions in September.
In September, State Attorney Shai Nitzan ordered all prosecutors to seek stiffer penalties for rock throwing, even by minors. He also directed prosecutors to ask courts to remand defendants until the end of their trials.
Also in September, the security cabinet unanimously approved a series of measures to counter rock-throwing, including loosening the rules of engagement to allow security forces to use live fire against rock-throwers.
